author: Daniel Greene
description:
Frank Herbert’s Dune isn’t just science fiction—it’s science fantasy, and few books have ever blended the two so perfectly. In this video, I explore how Dune uses its iconic sandworms to create a world where sci-fi tech and fantasy metaphor collide.

The sandworms (Shai Huluh) of Arrakis aren't just monsters—they're dragons, hoarders of power and guardians of transformation. From Paul Atreides’ arc to the religious structures of the Fremen, Dune draws from fantasy more than it gets credit for. Let’s dive in.

title: How Dune's Dragons Perfect Sci-Fantasy
